summary: This document is an internal email chain from September 4, 2019, discussing a New York Post article titled 'John Doe begs judge not to name names in Epstein gal pal case.' The FBI New York office is trying to identify the anonymous 'John Doe' mentioned in the article, which relates to a sealed lawsuit involving accusations against a long list of men.

events.title: Publication of NY Post article on anonymous John Doe
events.description: The New York Post publishes an article titled 'John Doe begs judge not to name names in Epstein gal pal case,' reporting on an anonymous individual seeking to prevent their name from being disclosed in a lawsuit related to Jeffrey Epstein.

keyFacts: An internal FBI email chain from September 4, 2019, discusses a New York Post article about an anonymous 'John Doe' in the Epstein case.
The article reports that 'John Doe' is petitioning a judge to keep their name sealed in a lawsuit brought by an accuser of Jeffrey Epstein.
The lawsuit involves accusations against 'a long list of men,' indicating broader potential co-conspirators or associates.
The FBI New York office is actively trying to identify this anonymous individual, showing investigative interest in the sealed case details.
